docs.lead_paragraph: Two Republican senators on Thursday issued a report accusing the Obama administration of pushing ahead with last October's botched rollout of HealthCare.gov website despite internal concerns that the technology would not work.

docs.lead_paragraph: The 11 bills, a bipartisan deal reached in the state Senate, represented a slimmer package than the 23 bills passed last week by the Senate. They aim to increase access to addiction treatment and raise penalties for illegal opioid sales.

headline.main: New York Legislature Reaches Deal on More Laws to Fight Heroin Problem
headline.print_headline: State Legislature Reaches Agreement on More Measures to Fight Heroin Problem

docs.abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, along with state legislators, announces agreement on set of bills to improve access to addiction treatment and stiffen penalties for doctors and pharmacists who illegally sell opioid pills; legislation is part of continuing push to tackle New York State's heroin problem.
docs.snippet: The 11 bills, a bipartisan deal reached in the state Senate, represented a slimmer package than the 23 bills passed last week by the Senate. They aim to increase access to addiction treatment and raise penalties for illegal opioid sales.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal authorities and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission are seeking evidence for a grand jury investigation into whether congressional staff provided tips to Wall Street traders about a change in healthcare policy, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.
